column2: GOP 'Beast' Candidate John Cox Brings A Bear To Campaign Kickoff
column5: Republican John Cox is nothing if not persistent. He's run for office five times in California and never won. Now he is vying to be the Republican replacement for Gavin Newsom -- if the state recalls Newsom which they won't. Nevertheless Cox persists. He kicked off his campaign in Sacramento on Tuesday with a Kodiak bear intended I suppose to be a metaphor for him as some sort of beast. Of course the California state flag also has the now-extinct California grizzly bear on it so it's more likely that the Kodiak bear was intended to be a substitute. Or a beast. Or something. The bear was supplied by Steve Martin's Working Wildlife (not THE Steve Martin don't panic!). This animal factory has had lots of complaints in the past.
